info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 6:14PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Allen, northern Wabash, Whitley, northwestern Huntington, southeastern Kosciusko and north central Miami Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 614 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near North Webster to 9 miles south of Akron. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Columbia City and Tri-lakes around 625 PM EDT. North Manchester around 630 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Churubusco, Andrews and Huntington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for north central and northeastern Indiana. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for north central and northeastern Indiana.
